Problem:
Let us consider a control system governed by the differential equation \( \dot{x} = Ax + Bu \), where \( A \) and \( B \) are constant matrices and \( u(t) \) represents a control input vector. The Laplace transform \( X(s) = \mathcal{L}\{x(t)\} \) applied to this system results in \( X(s) = (sI - A)^{-1}BU(s) + (sI - A)^{-1}x(0) \) where \( U(s) \) is the Laplace transform of \( u(t) \).

If a different matrix \( C \) is used to modify the system matrix \( A \) to \( A+C \) at time \( t_1 \), will this change reflect in the Laplace transform \( X(s) \) for all values of \( s \)?
Explanation: Altering the system matrix from \( A \) to \( A+C \) changes the system dynamics, which is reflected in the Laplace transform through the term \( (sI - (A+C))^{-1} \). This change affects how the system responds to inputs and initial conditions, thus modifying \( X(s) \) across all complex values \( s \).
